alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Nye County; Northwestern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:03PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Gusty winds expected through Wednesday... A slow moving, strong low pressure system off of the Northern California Coast will bring gusty south winds to much of Nevada this afternoon with a frontal passage expected to repeat these winds Wednesday. South winds have already increase this afternoon reaching speeds of 25 to 30 mph and gusts around 30 to 40 mph. Some isolated locations may even see gust approaching 45 mph. The highest winds will be located across ridge lines and the US-50 corridor in Central Nevada with slightly lower wind speeds for areas in Northern Nevada. Some blowing dust can be expected but widespread impacts to visibility possible. Motorists traveling along east- west routes could have a challenging trip with gusty crosswinds, especially for high profile vehicles. Also, secure loose objects outside that could be blown over or away. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
